summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing preparations for a briefing for the Attorney General (AG) regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It outlines key findings from the investigation, including the failure of two prison officers to conduct required checks and the fact Epstein was left without a cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; he committed suicide in his cell at the MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Final Night in MCC
events.description: The night leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The two prison officers failed to conduct required counts and rounds, and no official observed Epstein from approximately 9:30 PM.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's body was discovered in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:30 a.m.

events.title: Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Contrary to MCC policy and a directive, Epstein was left without a cellmate from the morning of August 9 through his death.

events.title: AG Briefing Preparation
events.description: SDNY staff correspond to prepare a briefing for the Attorney General on the investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The investigation into Epstein's death involved over 40 witness interviews (27 MCC employees, 16 inmates), review of financial records, cellphone searches, and recovery of limited, corrupted video evidence.
Two prison officers,  and , failed to conduct any of the required institutional counts at 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m., and falsified forms indicating they had performed their duties.
No prison official observed Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 9:30 PM on August 9 until his body was discovered around 6:30 AM on August 10.
Epstein was left without a cellmate from the morning of August 9 until his death, contrary to MCC policy and a specific directive from the Chief Psychologist and then-Warden.
The document is an internal email preparing a briefing for the Attorney General, highlighting the 'limited video evidence issue' due to a 'heavily corrupted system.'
